Module Paint3001
Package paint

Class PaintCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
        • paint.PaintCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class PaintCanvas
extends javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas
    Extends Canvas to create a square-shaped canvas that is resizable, along with a undo stack GUI component that updates

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class javafx.scene.Node

        BASELINE_OFFSET_SAME_AS_HEIGHT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PaintCanvas​(int pixels, UndoHistoryListView<java.lang.String> undoStack)
      Creates a square canvas of certain size given its size in pixels and also undo stack GUI component which it updates after a new shape is drawn.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaintCanvas

        public PaintCanvas​(int pixels,
                   UndoHistoryListView<java.lang.String> undoStack)
        Creates a square canvas of certain size given its size in pixels and also undo stack GUI component which it updates after a new shape is drawn.
        Parameters:
        pixels - number representing the size of the canvas
        undoStack - list view representing the actions of the user

        Initialise shapes when user makes first mouse click on canvas

      • addMouseMoveEventHandler

        public void addMouseMoveEventHandler()
        Add event to let the user to see change to their polygon in real time

      • addMouseDraggedEventHandler

        public void addMouseDraggedEventHandler()
        Add event to let users see their RECTANGLE, ELLIPSE and LINE shapes in real time as they draw

      • addMouseReleasedEventHandler

        public void addMouseReleasedEventHandler()
        Add event so when user stops drawing, a new shape is added to the list of actions. At the same time, the undo history stack is updated to show user new listing and the previous history stacks are erased.

        Returns list of actions of the canvas
        Returns:
        ArrayList(Action)

      • addToActions

        public void addToActions​(Action action)
        Given an action object, an addition is made to the canvas's current list of actions with the specified action
        Parameters:
        action - an action object such as SetFill, SetLine, PaintPlot and so on.

      • setFillColour

        public void setFillColour​(javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
        Given the colour, the canvas's fill colour property is set to the specified colour
        Parameters:
        colour - colour object representing shape fill such as a HEX colour value

      • setPenColour

        public void setPenColour​(javafx.scene.paint.Color colour)
        Given the colour, the canvas's pen colour property is set to the specified colour
        Parameters:
        colour - colour object for the pen such as a HEX colour value

      • completePolygon

        public void completePolygon()
        Closes the polygon shape using its initial coordinates.

      • clearActions

        public void clearActions()
        Erases all of the actions stored in the actions property.

      • updateActions

        public void updateActions​(java.util.ArrayList<Action> actions)
        Updates the actions property.
        Parameters:
        actions - new actions list which usually has additions or removals

      • undoAction

        public void undoAction()
        Updates the actions property by deleting the most recent action object and redraws the canvas while also updating the undo stack.

      • updateUndoList

        public void updateUndoList​(java.util.ArrayList<Action> newUndoList)
        Given the new undo list the undoActions property is set the the specified values.
        Parameters:
        newUndoList - new undoList which has either additions or removals from the current undoActions

      • redoAction

        public void redoAction()
        Moves the most recent action object stored in the undoActions back to masters action list and redraws the canvas.

      • redraw

        public void redraw()
        Redraw the canvas using the current actions list.
